bash_examples.compare module

bash_examples.inference module

bash_examples.inference.inference(conf: DictConfig) → List[DataFrame][source]

Make inference on a selected set starting from a configuration file

Parameters:

conf (DictConfig) – inference configuration, usually the one generated by the train with all the paths and parameters. See the examples in the repo

Returns:

3 dataframes:

errors : containing the errors res : containing the predictions losses : containing the losses during the train

Return type:

List[pd.DataFrame]

bash_examples.inference.mape(x: array, y: array) → float[source]

custom mape avoinding nan

Parameters:

  • x (np.array) – predicted

  • y (np.array) – real

Returns:

mape

Return type:

float

bash_examples.train module

bash_examples.train.train(conf: DictConfig) → None[source]

Train a DL model

Parameters:

conf (DictConfig) – dictionary whit all the parameters (split, normalization and training). Some of the parameters required will be filled looking to the timeserie definition. See the examples in the repo.
